question.text: The table gives the first four ionization energies in <math><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> of four elements (the letters are not the symbols for the elements). Which element occurs in Group 13 of the periodic table?

options.text: <math><mtable><mtr><mtd/><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>502</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4569</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>6919</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9550</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math><mtable><mtr><mtd/><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>526</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7305</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>11822</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math><mtable><mtr><mtd/><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>584</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1823</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2751</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11584</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

<math><mtable><mtr><mtd/><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>796</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1583</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mtable><mtr><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mtd><mtd><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>3238</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4362</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>

solution.text: After losing three electrons in element R, there is sudden huge increase in IE from 2751 to 11584 kJ/mol. It means that after three electrons, some stable configuration is achieved. This is applicable to group 13 elements with outer configuration of <math><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math> .
